seng301.assn4.funds

Class FundsFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • seng301.assn4.funds.FundsFacade

  • public class FundsFacade
extends java.lang.Object
    Controls all interaction with funds.
    Author:
    Robert J. Walker

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FundsFacade(org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.HardwareFacade hf)
      Basic constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deregister(FundsListener listener)
      De-registers the given listener from this facade so that the listener will no longer be notified of events emanating from here.
      org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.Cents getAvailableFunds()
      Deprecated. 
      The total amount of funds will not be a simple calculation in all circumstances. Use getAvailableFunds() instead. The method will not be removed any time soon.
      boolean hasAvailableFunds(org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.Cents funds)
      Checks to see if the available funds in the machine are at least equal to the indicated amount.
      void register(FundsListener listener)
      Registers the given listener with this facade so that the listener will be notified of events emanating from here.
      void returnUnusedFunds()
      Returns as much of the unused funds as is possible.
      void storeFunds(org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.Cents funds)
      Stores the indicated amount of funds so that it will no longer be available for use.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FundsFacade

        public FundsFacade(org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.HardwareFacade hf)
        Basic constructor.
        Parameters:
        hf - The hardware facade that will be used to implement all low-level functions.

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public void register(FundsListener listener)
        Registers the given listener with this facade so that the listener will be notified of events emanating from here.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be registered. No effect if it is already registered. Cannot be null.

      • deregister

        public void deregister(FundsListener listener)
        De-registers the given listener from this facade so that the listener will no longer be notified of events emanating from here.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to be de-registered. No effect if it is not already registered or null.

      • getAvailableFunds

        public org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.Cents getAvailableFunds()
        Deprecated. The total amount of funds will not be a simple calculation in all circumstances. Use getAvailableFunds() instead. The method will not be removed any time soon.
        Accesses the total amount of funds that can possibly be used. In some circumstances this is not a good idea (like with credit cards) so it is deprecated.
        Returns:
        The total funds available for use.

      • hasAvailableFunds

        public boolean hasAvailableFunds(org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.Cents funds)
        Checks to see if the available funds in the machine are at least equal to the indicated amount.
        Parameters:
        funds - The amount to check for. To be meaningful, this should really be a positive amount.
        Returns:
        true if the indicated amount is available; otherwise false.

      • storeFunds

        public void storeFunds(org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.Cents funds)
                throws org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.CapacityExceededException,
                       org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.DisabledException
        Stores the indicated amount of funds so that it will no longer be available for use. The remainder will continue to be available for use.
        Parameters:
        funds - The amount to be stored.
        Throws:
        org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.CapacityExceededException - If storing this amount will cause the capacity of some hardware to be exceeded.
        org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.DisabledException - If storing this amount will cause the use of a disabled piece of hardware.

      • returnUnusedFunds

        public void returnUnusedFunds()
                       throws org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.CapacityExceededException,
                              org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.DisabledException
        Returns as much of the unused funds as is possible. Any excess amount that cannot be returned will continue to be available as a credit.
        Throws:
        org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.CapacityExceededException - If returning this amount will cause the capacity of some hardware to be exceeded.
        org.lsmr.vending.frontend4.hardware.DisabledException - If returning this amount will cause the use of a disabled piece of hardware.
